cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 475 mi ESE of Isla Beata, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: moving WNW across the Caribbean, forecast to slow and turn NW, reaching Cuba then the eastern Gulf of Mexico and the west-central Florida coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west-central Florida coast near or just north of Tampa

weather_observation.watch_coast: Current watches confined to Hispaniola, Jamaica and Cuba – none yet for U.S. coastline
weather_observation.warning_coast: Current warnings confined to Hispaniola and Jamaica – none yet for U.S. coastline
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southern Hispaniola, Jamaica, Cuba, then Florida west coast from the Keys through the Big Bend region
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–55 mph) possible Tuesday with a small chance of 50-kt gusts
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation above ground possible along Tampa Bay and adjacent Gulf coast if Elsa tracks near shore
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches with locally higher amounts could cause flooding in low-lying and urban areas
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands
